arm_group.description: HIV infected women who are pregnant and receiving care in Harris County Hospital District single arm study Single arm study

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to evaluate why the majority of HIV infected women in the
      Harris County Health District system who are pregnant do not come to clinic for their HIV
      disease after they have a baby through questionaires administered prepartum and
      questionaires and structured interviews postpartum.  The study will ask subjects questions
      about HIV, drug use, depression and social problems.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Barriers to Postpartum Care in HIV Infected Women

detailed_description.textblock:
This study is evaluating information pre and postpartum to assess what are barriers to
      patients coming into care for HIV after they have a baby.  We will try to evaluate recurrent
      themes in questionaires and interviews to try and identify the barriers to care.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria: HIV infected pregnant women who

          -  HIV-infected women who are pregnant by confirmatory tests or an HIV positive woman
             who has had a baby within the last 6 months and is coming to care postpartum.

          -  Women who intend to get care at Harris County Hospital District.

          -  Subjects must be >18 years old.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Women unable to complete questionnaires.

          -  Women who are unable to speak, read, or understand English or Spanish.

intervention.description: We will do questionaires on pregnant women before they have their baby and after they have their baby.  We will do structured interviews after they have their baby

facility.name: Harris County Hospital District Clinics-Thomas Street Clinic, Northwest Clinic
Harris County Hospital District Clinics-LBJ hospital

clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Barriers to Postpartum Care in HIV Infected Women

overall_official.affiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

primary_outcome.description: we will ask and record responses and enter into an NIVIVO program to evaluate for emergent themes
primary_outcome.time_frame: women seen after they have their baby

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

secondary_outcome.description: we will evaluate responses from questionaires There will be 8 areas that there are questionnaires about. These include basic information about yourself, about stress, about your support system, about your sense of control, about tobacco use, about for alcohol/drug use, about taking your HIV medications, and about depression.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: before they have a baby and after they have a baby

clinical_study.source: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

lead_sponsor.agency: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
